question.text: Select the correct combination of gland to its hormone and function.

options.text:
Source gland Hormone Function
Thyroid Thyroxine Regulates blood calcium level

Source gland Hormone Function
Anterior pituitary Oxytocin Contraction of uterus muscles during child birth

Source gland Hormone Function
Posterior pituitary Vasopressin Stimulates reabsorption of water in the DCT of the nephron

Source gland Hormone Function
Corpus luteum Oestrogen Supports pregnancy

solution.text: Thyroxine from the thyroid gland helps in regulating the basal metabolism rate. Thyrocalcitonin from thyroid helps in decreasing calcium levels in the blood and depositing it on bones. Oxytocin is secreted by the hypothalamus but stored and released by the posterior pituitary. It is also called birth hormone. Corpus luteum produces a small amount of estrogen but large amounts of progesterone which supports a pregnancy.
